H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H6810.def: literally: small; hence: = state in which humans are considered unworthy of honor and respect

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H8380.def: = two children or young animals born at the same birth

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H132.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color; ≈ often associated with beauty

H8181.def: = the fine thread-like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals

H155.def: = state of being regarded with honor and respect

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H6215.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and older brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► who sold his birthright for a bowl of lentil stew; regarded as ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6215.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and older brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► who sold his birthright for a bowl of lentil stew; regarded as ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H6119.def: = the back part of the foot of humans and animals below the ankle

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3327.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>} and {L:Sarah<SDBH:שָׂרָה>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>} and {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}

H8346.def: = state in which a countable entity is the sixth in a range

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

14.gl: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H6215.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and older brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► who sold his birthright for a bowl of lentil stew; regarded as ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H6718.def: = action by which humans track and catch animals, ► usually to kill them for food

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H8535.def: literally: completed; hence: = state in which two objects have been made into one

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
